name.description: The name of the imagery source

i18n.description: Whether the imagery name should be translated

category.description: A rough categorisation of different types of layers. See https://github.com/osmlab/editor-layer-index/blob/gh-pages/CONTRIBUTING.md#categories for a description of the individual categories.

url.description: A URL template for imagery tiles

permission_osm.description: explicit/implicit permission by the owner for use in OSM

license_url.description: A URL for the license or permissions for the imagery

privacy_policy_url.description: A URL for the privacy policy of the operator or false if there is no existing privacy policy for tis imagery.

id.description: A unique identifier for the source; used in imagery_used changeset tag

description.description: A short English-language description of the source

country_code.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two letter country code in upper case. Use ZZ for unknown or multiple.

default.description: Whether this imagery should be shown in the default world-wide menu

best.description: Whether this imagery is the best source for the region

start_date.description: The age of the oldest imagery or data in the source, as an RFC3339 date or leading portion of one

end_date.description: The age of the newest imagery or data in the source, as an RFC3339 date or leading portion of one

no_tile_header.description: HTTP header to check for information if the tile is invalid

overlay.description: 'true' if tiles are transparent and can be overlaid on another source

icon.description: A URL for an image, that can be displayed in the list of imagery layers next to the name

eula.description: A link to an EULA text that has to be accepted by the user, before the imagery source is added. Can contain {lang} to be replaced by a current user language wiki code (like FR:) or an empty string for the default English text.

logo-image.description: A URL for an image, that is displayed in the mapview for attribution

terms-of-use-text.description: Customized text for the terms of use link (default is "Background Terms of Use")

no-tile-checksum.description: Specify a checksum for tiles, which aren't real tiles. `type` is the digest type and can be MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384 and SHA-512, value is the hex encoded checksum in lower case. To create a checksum save the tile as file and upload it to e.g. https://defuse.ca/checksums.htm.

metadata-header.description: header-name attribute specifies a header returned by tile server, that will be shown as `metadata-key` attribute in Show Tile Info dialog

valid-georeference.description: Set to `true` if imagery source is properly aligned and does not need imagery offset adjustments. This is used for OSM based sources too.

tile-size.description: Size of individual tiles delivered by a TMS service

mod-tile-features.description: Whether tiles status can be accessed by appending /status to the tile URL and can be submitted for re-rendering by appending /dirty.

custom-http-headers.description: HTTP headers to be sent to server. It has two attributes header-name and header-value. May be specified multiple times.

mirror.description: A different mirror of the data, e.g. a TMS for WMS servers. Supports `type`, `id`, `url`, `available_projections`, `min-zoom`, `max-zoom` and `privacy_policy_url` properties.

id.description: A unique identifier for the source; used in imagery_used changeset tag

url.description: A URL template for imagery tiles

privacy_policy_url.description: A URL for the privacy policy of the operator

default-layers.description: Default layer to open (when using WMS_ENDPOINT type). Contains list of layer tag with two attributes - name and style, e.g. `"default-layers": ["layer": { name="Basisdata_NP_Basiskart_JanMayen_WMTS_25829" "style":"default" } ]` (not allowed in `mirror` attribute)

format.description: format to use when connecting tile server (when using WMS_ENDPOINT type)

transparent.description: If `true` transparent tiles will be requested from WMS server

minimum-tile-expire.description: minimum expiry time for tiles in seconds. The larger the value, the longer entry in cache will be considered valid
